verbs.description: uncrumple (third-person singular simple present uncrumples, present participle uncrumpling, simple past and past participle uncrumpled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To return something that has been crumpled closer to its original state.
examples: I took the wadded-up letter from the trash and carefully uncrumpled it.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) Having been crumpled, to return closer to its original state.
examples: As the newspaper uncrumpled, the picture on the front page became recognizable.
